data.name: access
data.label: Access Type
data.help: Choose how you want your files to be accessible for the specified price.
data.disclaimer: Please do not provide downloadable personal data without the consent of the data subjects.

data.name: providerUrl
data.label: Provider URL
data.help: Enter the URL for your custom [provider](https://github.com/oceanprotocol/provider/) or leave as is to use the default one. If you change your provider URL after adding your file, please add & validate your file again.

fields.title: URL
fields.label: File
fields.help: This URL will be stored encrypted after publishing. **Please make sure that the endpoint is accessible over the internet and is not protected by a firewall or by credentials.**
fields.computeHelp: For a compute dataset, your file should match the file type required by the algorithm, and should not exceed 1 GB in file size.

innerFields.title: Headers
innerFields.label: Headers
innerFields.help: This HEADERS will be stored encrypted after publishing.

fields.title: IPFS
fields.label: CID
fields.help: This CID will be stored encrypted after publishing.
fields.computeHelp: For a compute dataset, your file should match the file type required by the algorithm, and should not exceed 1 GB in file size.

fields.title: Arweave
fields.label: Transaction ID
fields.help: This Transaction ID will be stored encrypted after publishing.
fields.computeHelp: For a compute dataset, your file should match the file type required by the algorithm, and should not exceed 1 GB in file size.

fields.title: Graphql
fields.label: URL
fields.help: This URL will be stored encrypted after publishing.
fields.computeHelp: For a compute dataset, your file should match the file type required by the algorithm, and should not exceed 1 GB in file size.

innerFields.title: Headers
innerFields.label: Headers
innerFields.help: This HEADERS will be stored encrypted after publishing.

innerFields.title: Query
innerFields.label: Query
innerFields.help: This QUERY will be stored encrypted after publishing.

data.name: timeout
data.label: Timeout
data.help: Define how long buyers should be able to download the dataset again after the initial purchase.

data.name: state
data.label: Asset Service Status
data.help: This asset service will no longer be visible to other users and it won't be possible to purchase it.  More info available in our [docs](https://docs.oceanprotocol.com/core-concepts/did-ddo#state).

data.name: usesConsumerParameters
data.label: Algorithm custom parameters
data.help: Algorithm custom parameters are used to define required consumer input before running the algorithm in a Compute-to-Data environment.
options: This asset uses algorithm custom parameters

data.name: paymentCollector
data.label: Payment Collector Address
data.help: This address will receive the revenue from all sales. More info available in our [docs](https://docs.oceanprotocol.com/core-concepts/datanft-and-datatoken#revenue).

data.name: usesServiceConsumerParameters
data.label: User defined parameters
data.help: User defined parameters are used to filter or query the published asset.
options: This asset uses user defined parameters

data.name: allow
data.label: Allow ETH Address
data.help: Enter an ETH address and click the ADD button to append to the list. Only ETH addresses in the allow list can consume this service. If the list is empty anyone can use this service.

data.name: deny
data.label: Deny ETH Address
data.help: Enter an ETH address and click the ADD button to append to the list. If an ETH address is in the deny list, download or compute of this service will be denied for that ETH address.
